text:
When loading a script, it sometimes happens that some (usually just one) test
elements in the test plan are huge in height. The screenshot is quite
self-explanatory. The workaround to bring these huge items, is to disable and
then re-enable them.
creator: quasar7@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 20795
Description of the bug
creator: quasar7@gmail.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Yes, this does seem to happen occasionally - we're not sure why. It may be a 
Java bug.

Closing and reopening the test plan usually fixes it, but it's useful to have 
a work-round that does not require this.

For the records, this is the version I've tested:
java version "1.5.0_12"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_12-b04)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_12-b04, mixed mode, sharing)
creator: quasar7@gmail.com
sebb@apache.org
text: *** Bug 49321 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Never met this issue since JMeter 2.4.0.
Shouldn't it be closed ? anyway what can we do about it ?

Seems to be fixed in later versions of Java and JMeter.

If not, please re-open with full details of Java, OS and JMeter.
creator: sebb@apache.org
